name: locally of finite type
description: A morphism $f : X \to Y$ of schemes is of finite type at $x \in X$ if there exist affine opens $U = \Spec A \subset X$ containing $x$ and $V = \Spec B \subset Y$ with $f(U) \subset V$ such that $A$ is a finitely generated $B$-algebra via the induced map $B 	o A$. The morphism $f$ is locally of finite type if it is of finite type at each $x \in X$.
